attributes.action: grant a full pardon to Frances Inglis
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Frances Inglis has been given a life sentence for killing her 22-year-old son Tom after he suffered severe brain damage when he fell out of a moving ambulance. 
Mrs Inglis acted as any mother would, out of love and humanity, yet she has been subjected to the full rigour of the law without the benefit of compassion that a civilized society should be able to extend to those who deserve it.
Justice must always be done but it should be tempered with humanity and compassion.
Any mother who suffers the death of a child is already condemned to a life sentence.
Mrs Inglis should be freed and returned to her family.

rejection.details: Individual sentences are a matter for the Courts, who are independent of Government.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
